content:
PrintPreviewControl Class

Definition

Represents the raw preview part of print previewing from a Windows Forms application, without any dialog boxes or buttons. Most PrintPreviewControl objects are found on PrintPreviewDialog objects, but they do not have to be.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.DefaultProperty("Document")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterface(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterfaceType.AutoDispatch)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
public class PrintPreviewControl : System.Windows.Forms.Control

Remarks

When you create an instance of the PrintPreviewControl class, some of the read/write properties are set to initial values. For a list of these values, see the PrintPreviewControl constructor.

For more information about printing with Windows Forms, see the System.Drawing.Printing namespace overview. If you wish to print from a Windows Presentation Foundation application, see the System.Printing namespace.

Constructors

PrintPreviewControl()

Initializes a new instance of the PrintPreviewControl class.

public PrintPreviewControl ();

Remarks

When you create an instance of the PrintPreviewControl class, the following read/write properties are initialized.

Property Default Value
AutoZoom true
Document null
Columns 1
Rows 0
StartPage 0

You can change the value for any of these properties through a separate call to the property.

Properties

AutoZoom

Gets or sets a value indicating whether resizing the control or changing the number of pages shown automatically adjusts the stem.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Zoom* property.

public bool AutoZoom { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the changing the control size or number of pages adjusts the stem.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Zoom* property; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Columns

Gets or sets the number of pages displayed horizontally across the screen.

public int Columns { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The number of pages displayed horizontally across the screen. The default is 1.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The set value is less than 1.

CreateParams

Gets the required creation parameters when the control handle is created.

protected override System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams CreateParams { get; }
Value
CreateParams

A CreateParams that contains the required creation parameters when the handle to the control is created.

Document

Gets or sets a value indicating the document to preview.

public System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument Document { get; set; }
Value
PrintDocument

The PrintDocument representing the document to preview.

RightToLeft

Gets or sets a value indicating whether control's elements are aligned to support locales using right-to-left fonts.

public override System.Windows.Forms.RightToLeft RightToLeft { get; set; }
Value
RightToLeft

One of the RightToLeft values. The default is RightToLeft.

Rows

Gets or sets the number of pages displayed vertically down the screen.

public int Rows { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The number of pages displayed vertically down the screen. The default is 0.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The set value is less than 1.

StartPage

Gets or sets the page number of the upper left page.

public int StartPage { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The page number of the upper left page. The default is 0.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

The set value is less than 0.

Text

Gets or sets the text associated with this control.

public override string Text { get; set; }
Value
String

The text associated with this control.

UseAntiAlias

Gets or sets a value indicating whether printing uses the anti-aliasing features of the operating system.

public bool UseAntiAlias { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if anti-aliasing is used; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Anti-aliasing removes jagged lines when fonts are rendered.

Zoom

Gets or sets a value indicating how large the pages will appear.

public double Zoom { get; set; }
Value
Double

A value indicating how large the pages will appear. A value of 1.0 indicates full size.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The value is less than or equal to 0.

Methods

InvalidatePreview()

Refreshes the preview of the document.

public void InvalidatePreview ();

Remarks

Call this method if the document appearance has changed.

OnPaint(PaintEventArgs)

Overrides the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.OnPaint* method.

protected override void OnPaint (System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs pevent);
pevent
PaintEventArgs

A PaintEventArgs that contains the event data.

OnResize(EventArgs)

Raises the Resize event.

protected override void OnResize (EventArgs eventargs);
eventargs
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

If the AutoZoom property is set to true, the OnResize method resizes the page in proportion to the PrintPreviewControl control. If AutoZoom is false, the PrintPreviewControl centers the page on the control.

OnStartPageChanged(EventArgs)

Raises the StartPageChanged event.

protected virtual void OnStartPageChanged (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

The OnStartPageChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

ResetBackColor()

Resets the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.BackColor* property to stem.Drawing.SystemColors.AppWorkspace*, which is the default color.

public override void ResetBackColor ();

Remarks

You typically use this method if you are either creating a designer for the PrintPreviewControl or creating your own control incorporating the PrintPreviewControl.

ResetForeColor()

Resets the foreground color of the PrintPreviewControl to stem.Drawing.Color.White*, which is the default color.

public override void ResetForeColor ();

Remarks

You typically use this method if you are either creating a designer for the PrintPreviewControl or creating your own control incorporating the PrintPreviewControl.

WndProc(Message)

Overrides the stem.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc* method.

protected override void WndProc (ref System.Windows.Forms.Message m);
m
Message

The Windows Message to process.

Events

StartPageChanged

Occurs when the start page changes.

public event EventHandler StartPageChanged;

Remarks

For more information about handling events, see Events.

TextChanged

Occurs when the value of the stem.Windows.Forms.PrintPreviewControl.Text* property changes.

public event EventHandler TextChanged;
